summary: This document is a detailed timeline of events surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 10, 2019. It chronicles his activities on August 9, the discovery of his body, medical response, notifications to officials and family, and subsequent investigative actions by the FBI and OIG.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on the morning of August 10, 2019, and was later pronounced dead.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge overseeing Epstein's case was notified of his death at 10:00 am on August 10, 2019, and was later provided with the press release.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: Arrived at the institution at 7:30 am on August 10, notified the PIO of the incident, and later notified the OIG.

persons.name: Case Management Coordinator
persons.context: Notified Epstein's next of kin (his brother) at 11:00 am on August 10 and later traveled to Beekman Hospital.

persons.name: IDO
persons.context: Reported that Epstein was in good spirits during a social call at 7:00 pm on August 9. Later traveled to Beekman Hospital with the CMC.

persons.name: SIS Lt
persons.context: Notified of the incident at 7:20 am and arrived at the institution at 8:10 am on August 10. Later, SIS personnel went to the SHU to conduct interviews.

persons.name: Acting Chief Psychologist
persons.context: Notified of the incident at 7:40 am and arrived at the institution at 9:30 am on August 10.

persons.name: Computer Services Manager
persons.context: Arrived at the institution at 10:15 pm on August 10 to remove and replace hard drives from computers in the SHU.

persons.name: Regional Director
persons.context: Arrived at the institution on the morning of August 13, 2019.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: Arrived at the institution at 8:00 am on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: CMC
persons.context: Notified of the incident at 8:10 am, arrived at the institution at 9:15 am, and traveled to Beekman Hospital.

persons.name: SCSS
persons.context: Notified of the incident at 8:10 am and arrived at the institution at 9:50 am on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: PIO
persons.context: Notified of the incident by the Warden at 7:32 am and arrived at the institution at 10:45 am on August 10. Released the press release.

persons.name: ER Physician
persons.context: Reported the official time of death for Jeffrey Epstein at 7:36 am on August 10, 2019.

connections.description: Judge Berman was the presiding judge over Epstein's case and was officially notified of his death.
The CMC was responsible for notifying Epstein's next of kin (his brother) of his death and securing his property at the hospital.
The IDO reported on Epstein's condition during a social call the night before his death, stating he was in 'good spirits'.
The Warden directly notified the PIO of the incident, initiating the public information response.
The Warden notified the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) of the incident, prompting their investigation.
The CMC and IDO traveled together to Beekman Hospital following Epstein's death to handle procedures related to his body and property.
The SIS Lt was notified of the incident and SIS personnel later conducted interviews in the SHU where Epstein died.

events.title: Epstein's Final Day of Attorney Visits
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein spent the day in attorney conferences and was reported to be in 'good spirits' during a social call at 7:00 pm before returning to his cell in the SHU.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: At 6:33 am, a body alarm was activated in the SHU. Staff found inmate Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR was initiated by staff and continued by medical personnel and EMS.

events.title: Epstein Pronounced Dead
events.description: At 7:36 am, the official time of death was reported by an ER physician at Beekman Hospital. Epstein had been transported there after failed resuscitation attempts.

events.title: Next of Kin Notification
events.description: At 11:00 am, the Case Management Coordinator notified Epstein's brother (next of kin) of his death.

events.title: FBI and OIG Investigation Initiated
events.description: The FBI was notified at 8:34 am and arrived at the MCC later that day. The OIG was notified by the Warden and their agents arrived in the SHU in the afternoon to investigate the death.

events.title: SHU Computer Hard Drives Removed
events.description: At 10:15 pm, the Computer Services Manager arrived to remove hard drives from computers in the Special Housing Unit and replace them with new ones.

events.title: Staff Recall and FBI Investigation Continues
events.description: A staff recall was conducted at 1:00 pm. The FBI returned to the institution multiple times throughout the afternoon and evening.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the MCC New York at 6:33 am on August 10, 2019.
The night before his death (August 9, 7:00 pm), an Institution Duty Officer (IDO) reported Epstein was in 'good spirits' during a social call.
Hard drives from computers in the SHU were removed and replaced by a Computer Services Manager on the night of Epstein's death (August 10, 10:15 pm).
Multiple external agencies were swiftly notified and involved, including the FBI (notified at 8:34 am), the OIG, and Judge Berman.
The official time of death was reported by an ER physician at Beekman Hospital at 7:36 am on August 10, 2019.
